featured.text: Bekoji’s legend Derartu Tulu, who won the 10,000-meter Olympic gold medals in 1992 and 2000, is a national hero.
Motivated by such signs of success, thousands of kids from the villages surrounding Bekoji have moved into town.
It’s tempting, when breathing the thin air of Bekoji, to focus on the special conditions of the place.
They crowd the classrooms at Bekoji Elementary School, where Eshetu works as a physical-education instructor.
Most families in Bekoji live from hand to mouth, and distance running offers the younger generation a way out.

other.text: A strong desire burns inside Bekoji’s young runners.
What is the goal of Bekoji’s school kids? (A)
Which of the following is true about Bekoji?

definition.zh_def: 一種在埃塞俄比亞的傳統咖啡儀式，通常涉及烘焙、磨碎和沖泡咖啡。
definition.en_def: A traditional Ethiopian coffee ceremony involving roasting, grinding, and brewing coffee.
definition.example: During the bekoji, the aroma of freshly roasted coffee filled the room.
